caption: b'Together, we can achieve a future with net zero emissions \xe2\x80\x94 to ensure a cleaner tomorrow for our next generation.'

b'60,000 \xe2\x80\x94 that\xe2\x80\x99s how many masks we ordered for our employees from bFIVE40, a small women-owned business in South Carolina. We\xe2\x80\x99re proud to support a local business in a community we serve, while also ensuring our employees remain safe during the pandemic.
 
We\xe2\x80\x99re in this together. #ActionsSpeakLouder
 
Click the link in our bio to learn more about this local South Carolina business and its connection to @mikerowe.'

b'When they\xe2\x80\x99re not transporting kids to and from school, :school: electric buses are powerful, portable batteries! :battery: \nThey can be an energy backup during a power outage or emergency :police_car_light: or even work as battery storage to support renewable energy! :dashing_away: :bright_button:'

b'We are proud to support the National Native American Veterans Memorial, which opened this month at the National Museum of the American Indian in Washington, D.C. A couple of our employees recently visited the memorial and museum to mark Native American Heritage Month, and to reflect on what this memorial means to them. While the museum is currently closed due to the pandemic, we are excited to give you an exclusive look.'
b"We're making steady progress toward our commitment to net zero emissions by 2050.\n\nClick the link in our bio to learn more."
b'Newly installed LED lights at @vaunion1865 provide students, faculty and visitors with a safe well-lit campus while also making the university more energy efficient.'

b'Our offshore wind project is estimated to create approximately 900 clean energy jobs annually during construction and 1,100 jobs annually during the operation of the turbines in Virginia.\n\nAnd it will reduce our reliance on sources of energy that generate carbon emissions, the equivalent of taking 1 million non-EV cars off the road each year.'

b"On this #VeteransDay, we're proud to share our support of the Warrior PATHH program for veterans experiencing post-traumatic stress. We are thankful for those who have sacrificed so much to protect us and we honor the brave men and women who defend our freedoms around the world."

b'What were you doing for your community at 10-years-old? Ava Rajappa just launched her own nonprofit, Art Love. Since the pandemic began, Ava wanted to give other students a way to create and explore and has donated over 2,500 art kits to children in her community. :crayon: :artist_palette: :pencil_selector:
.
.
When asked why she came up with this idea, Ava said "Other kids didn't really have art supplies, and now they do. That makes me really happy."'
b'Electric, driverless vehicles: safer, cleaner, greener. :battery: :high_voltage: :battery: :bus: We launched our first passenger shuttle today!\n#ActionsSpeakLouder'

:mobile_phone: Make a start, stop or transfer service request
:locked: Use Face or Touch ID login for secure access
:woman_running_selector: Manage your account on the go
:high_voltage: Electric customers can easily report outages and receive outage updates via push notifications

Click the link in our bio to learn more and download the app.

http://spr.ly/6175G4pD1'

b"ICYMI: Last week, a new source of clean, renewable energy became a reality for Virginians. It's just the start. :dashing_away: :globe_showing_Europe-Africa:"

b'We don\xe2\x80\x99t blame you for the double-take! You can\xe2\x80\x99t see these from land, but these turbines are cranking out emissions-free electricity, 27 miles off the coast of Virginia Beach. :water_wave:\n#offshorewind #renewables #cleanenergy'

b"And they're off! :dashing_away: 27 miles out to sea, both of our offshore wind turbines have completed rigorous reliability testing and are ready to produce clean, renewable wind energy to customers right here in Virginia. :deciduous_tree:"
b'A quick sneak peek :eyes: at the offshore wind turbines 27 miles out at sea! :water_wave: :dashing_away: Stay tuned: they reach a new milestone next week. :white_heavy_check_mark:'

b"Using valuable feedback from our customers, we've developed the new Dominion Energy app \xe2\x80\x94 launching today in the App Store and Google Play Store! All of our customers can use the free Dominion Energy app for fast, easy and secure account access at your fingertips.

Outage reporting is only available for our electric customers.

Click the link in our bio to learn more & download. 

http://spr.ly/6174GLHnr"

b'We love a good #TBT. It\xe2\x80\x99s hard to believe that it\xe2\x80\x99s been  about 2 1/2 years since our crews helped restore power to Puerto Rico after Hurricane Maria. Our crews spent over a month there helping to bring some normalcy back to the residents. In honor of National Hispanic Heritage Month, take a walk down #PoweringPR memory lane with us. #puertorico #lendahand #helpaneighbor #hispanicheritagemonth #restore'

b'Our downtown Richmond operations are getting cleaner and greener. New solar panels on our Tredegar campus will help power the spaces where our employees are working to bring us closer to a zero-emissions future. \n:high_voltage::deciduous_tree: :battery: :globe_showing_Europe-Africa:  Click link in bio for more info.:backhand_index_pointing_up:'

b'Four generations of know-how, exploration, and dedication got us to today. \nOur newest generation: wind, solar, hydrogen, battery storage, and more. \nA net zero emissions future is closer than ever.'

b'This Labor Day, we thank all of our employees for their work building the infrastructure necessary to move toward a sustainable energy future with good-paying clean energy jobs. :sun_selector: :construction_worker_medium_skin_tone:\xe2\x80\x8d'

b'#DYK, as a company we have pledged to create more than 500 acres of additional pollinator habitat by the end of 2022? This includes 60 acres of additional pollinator habitat at power stations, and pilot plots for habitat at solar sites. Learn more about our pollinator program, and steps we take to protect habitats and wildlife on our website. #NationalWildlifeDay'

b'Even though the school year may be looking a little different, school supplies are still a necessity! Yesterday a group of volunteers gathered to donate school supplies and care kits to Henrico County, Virginia teachers. :blue_book: :crayon: :pencil_selector:'

b'In honor of #NationalDogDay :dog_face: we wanted to introduce you to some of our four-legged coworkers who have been keeping us company during the pandemic. \n\nWatch our Story today to meet even more dogs from across our footprint!'

b'"What I love most about welding is the concept and theory behind it. It\xe2\x80\x99s such an art, and I am constantly being faced with a new challenge every day," said Kylie Hrubes, welding intern and overall inspiring person here at Dominion Energy. 

Kylie is no stranger to challenges. Five years ago she was in a head-on car crash which left her in such a condition that doctors said she would never walk again, or hold down a full-time job. Every day she is proving that wrong as she pursues her dream, and paves the way for others to do the same. 

"It only takes one person to set an example that will encourage many. I volunteer at the youth homeless shelter in Salt Lake City, Utah as a guest speaker. I use my story to inspire youth there to help give them a direction in life. I\xe2\x80\x99ve been told I\xe2\x80\x99ve inspired a few young females to pursue the trades. That alone is winning in my book!" #internprofile #dayinthelife #welding'

b'To the more than half a million customers impacted by Tropical Storm Isaias, thank you for your patience. More than 7000 crew and staff worked night and day to get the lights back on; we do that work for you.\n.\nAnd to the committed men and women who tirelessly serve their neighbors and communities on the front lines across our region, you inspire us.'

b"The lights are back on for 96% of our customers, thanks to the tireless work of more than 7,000 personnel working around the clock safely. 
.
We haven't forgotten about those customers who are still waiting for power to be restored and appreciate their patience. Additional crews continue to pour into the most devastated areas to speed the restoration work in Virginia Beach, Gloucester, Northern Neck, Chuckatuck, Newport News, and Hampton. 
.
Restoration for the majority of remaining customers is expected to be completed by end of day today, with a small number restored tomorrow (where damage was most severe). Customers can get more information about their expected restoration time by checking the outage map on our website."

b"What happens when you mix heavy rain, winds with gusts up to 60 mph, and a few reported tornadoes? More than 500,000 customers in Virginia and North Carolina experienced outages as a result of the fast-moving storm.\n\nCrews will continue to work safely, 24/7, until everyone's lights are back on."

b'Essential work takes on a whole new meaning when a hurricane hits during a pandemic. Our crews are on their way to restore power across our service area. Please be patient as they assess and repair storm damage.'

b'Our crews are ready and in position to respond to any damage that Tropical Storm Isaias may cause. \n\nBased on latest forecast, we anticipate heavy rain and high winds near Charleston, SC on Monday evening and to make its way to Central and Eastern VA by Tuesday morning.'

b'They may have been largely virtual this summer, but that didn't stop our interns from (safely) experiencing some big moments. One of our intern ambassadors, Lauren Lemelin, found herself front and center for the grand reveal of our Coastal Virginia Offshore Wind Pilot Project back in June. 
.
"It is a huge milestone and accomplishment for clean energy in Virginia as well as the offshore wind industry in the United States. My hope is that this pilot project will propel economic development in Virginia, boost offshore wind development along the East Coast and lead to additional renewable energy initiatives in Virginia and across the country," said Lauren. 
.
Take a look at some behind-the-scenes photos Lauren shared with us.'

b'Our ERGs, or Employee Resource Groups, not only provide a sense of community, they also increase awareness of barriers that many employees face in their daily lives while promoting inclusion. All employees are welcome to participate, and many interns found opportunities to join in on ERG activities during their virtual summer internship. 
.
One of our intern ambassadors from Puerto Rico, Hennessy Bas, participated in activities with our Latino Resource Group, including a Spanish 101 course about food and dining. 
.
\xe2\x80\x9cAs a puertorrican, and simply as a person that will have to move far away from her family and everything that she knows, it feels very comforting to know that the company I am working for has a place where I can feel closer to home. ERGs bring diversity to a company and offer the opportunity to inform people about the different cultures that are present,\xe2\x80\x9d said Hennessy.'

b"Offshore wind doesn't just provide clean, renewable energy to homes and businesses. It powers our economy with thousands of good-paying, clean energy jobs, too. :woman_factory_worker: :woman_scientist: :man_technologist: :construction_worker:"

b'The first all-electric and autonomous shuttle in Northern Virginia will be here next week! Coming from our innovation team, in partnership with Fairfax County, the shuttle produces zero emissions, and is guaranteed to transform the way we travel. The innovation summer intern (and one of our intern ambassadors), Abdalla Osman, was recently able to see the shuttle in person. \n\n"This is a great step towards embracing the electrification of transportation. I think this project will open doors for other similar projects and I\'m looking forward to seeing how Dominion Energy will build upon this pilot," Abdalla said.'

b'It\xe2\x80\x99s coming\xe2\x80\x94the first all-electric and autonomous shuttle in partnership with Fairfax Co., VA! Shuttles like this one will help transform how we work, travel, shop, and live. Testing in the Mosaic District begins soon to ensure safety for riders and pedestrians.'

b'Our summer interns are learning from some former intern turned full-time employees this summer. Meet Taylor Zabinsky, our former digital communications and marketing intern and now full-time creative powerhouse here on the digital team at Dominion Energy. Taylor recently shared her advice and words of wisdom with nearly 150 of our amazing interns- virtually. \n\n"Having been in their position, I know it\xe2\x80\x99s comforting being able to talk with someone who had similar experiences. It\xe2\x80\x99s important for them to know everyone\xe2\x80\x99s internship is different, and it is truly what you make of it," said Taylor.'

b'Offshore wind turbine pilot :white_heavy_check_mark:
What\xe2\x80\x99s next? :light_bulb:
More communities powered by zero-emissions wind. :dashing_away:
A new offshore wind project is underway to power 650,000 MORE homes and businesses :house:
It\xe2\x80\x99s one way we are getting closer to our net zero emissions goal by 2050.'

b"Adaptable. Dependable. Always there. During a time of crisis, or just a regular day, our team members are on the front line every day providing a reliable and essential service while adapting to the new 'norm.' You can count on it."

b'There are no actions or words that will immediately heal the hurt caused by 400 years of institutional racism. And in this period of growth and change, both in our country and our company, actions must speak louder.

In building on initiatives we launched earlier this year, today we are announcing a $35 million initiative to support historically black colleges and universities as well as African American and minority students.

Click the link in our bio to learn more.'

b'This summer, our interns represent over 80 different majors from nearly 90 different schools. Meet three of these interns- Kylie, Lauren and Rasheed. :hugging_face:\n#interns #internshipprogram #internprofiles #careersinenergy'

b"Today we are sending a giant THANK YOU to our lineworkers alongside Edison Electric Institute for National Lineworker Appreciation Day. From storm recovery, to navigating the new 'norm' during the pandemic, our lineworkers are on the front line day in and day out like all of our essential workers. We couldn't do it without you. #ThankALineworker #PoweringThruTogether #NationalLineworkerAppreciationDay #Lineworker"

b'We have a responsibility to protect wildlife when we\xe2\x80\x99re producing energy. :light_bulb: :electric_plug: :battery: \nOur offshore wind projects are designed to produce clean energy and have a minimal impact to marine wildlife. :bird: :tropical_fish: :whale:'

b'We\xe2\x80\x99re proud to have interns from across the country and Puerto Rico as part of our Virtual Internship Program! Meet three of these interns- Hennessy, Abdalla and Hundley. :hugging_face: #interns #internshipprogram #internprofiles #careersinenergy'
b'Happy 4th of July! Unplug, spend some time outside, and stay safe! :United_States:'

b'"These turbines will help reach our net zero goal. This pilot program is just the start. I would have never guessed in college that I would transition to working in offshore wind development. As a minority engineer, it\xe2\x80\x99s great to be involved in a project that is a first in the US," said Manager- Generation Site Construction, Lloyd Eley.'
b'"The construction of these two turbines is a major milestone not only for offshore wind in Virginia but also for offshore wind in the United States"'
b'Good morning, it\xe2\x80\x99s a beautiful day for wind :dashing_away: power :electric_plug::light_bulb::battery:.'

b'Employee James Wilson knows it takes a village, perhaps now more than ever. In addition to his work in our Eastern- Regional Operations Center, Wilson runs the nonprofit hunger relief organization, Village Family. The pandemic has made their work even more vital (if that's possible), while also presenting them with new challenges in supporting the community when they need it most.
\xe2\x80\xa2
\xe2\x80\xa2
"Our vision is to improve the quality of life for all that come to us for help.  The demand continues to outweigh our limited resources and space provided. Much of the donated funds go to large nonprofits that have name recognition.  We are extremely grateful for our donors and dedicated volunteers," said Wilson.'
b"There's energy in diversity. #loveislove"

b"IIt's #pollinatorweek! :honeybee: :bat: :cherry_blossom: :tomato: \nDid you know we rely on birds, bees, and bats to pollinate about 30% of the food we eat? \nThey're critical to our planet, and we're working hard to protect them."

b'Pretty cool, eh? It\xe2\x80\x99s the first-ever offshore wind turbine installed in federal waters, 27 miles out to sea. Another one is coming this week, paving the way for big #windpower in Va! :dashing_away::battery::electric_plug:'

b"Today is the first official day of summer! As parts of the country begin to reopen and more families are traveling, if you\xe2\x80\x99re staying at a rental property like an Airbnb or a beach house for a family vacation, follow this safety checklist. :white_heavy_check_mark: Find your rental's fire extinguisher
:white_heavy_check_mark: Identify all exits of the home in case of an emergency
:white_heavy_check_mark: Determine the location of the electrical box
:white_heavy_check_mark: Locate water and gas valves in case an emergency shut off is needed"
b'Our internship program is going VIRTUAL this year. Join us as we follow along with six  interns during their unique experience. :hugging_face:'

b"Just a few days away from the first #offshorewind turbine installation off the coast of Virginia Beach! We're going big on wind for a smaller carbon footprint and a clean, sustainable energy future."
b'Love is love. :rainbow_flag_selector:'

b'The pandemic can't stop employee Chrissy Lowery from finding ways to help.
.
\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m someone who loves to volunteer. Since the coronavirus pandemic and subsequent \xe2\x80\x98lockdown,\xe2\x80\x99 I\xe2\x80\x99d been craving to volunteer in a way that was socially distanced," she said.
.
Lowery found Catchafire, an organization that connects nonprofits to potential volunteeers, through an employee initiative on virtual volunteering.
.
From there, she started volunteering with Wonder Connection, a small nonprofit in North Carolina who mission is to empower pediatric patients with nature and science.
.
\xe2\x80\x9cBecause I worked with the American Cancer Society and American Foundation for Suicide Prevention on nonprofit fundraising events and activities in college, I was so happy to be able to transfer the skills and ideas I had learned previously to benefit this organization."'

b'From concept to reality: watch as the offshore wind pilot is built, 27 miles out to sea. This clean, renewable pilot with \xc3\x98rsted and Siemens Gamesa will pave the way for a much larger project, able to power up to 650,000 homes with sustainable wind power! :house: Learn more: click link in bio :backhand_index_pointing_up:'

b'Learning a new skill while helping her local community? Count employee Dina Qureshi in. Since the pandemic began, Qureshi taught herself to sew, and has made over 250 masks for local hospitals and people in her community.
.
.
\xe2\x80\x9cThe thought of knowing many other essential workers were risking their lives and the lives of their families without the proper PPE really motivated me to try to provide them with masks which could lower their risk of getting the virus," Qureshi said.'

b'From our utilizing new technologies such as drones to updating our protocols to be consistent with social distancing guidelines, our goal remains the same \xe2\x80\x94 providing safe and reliable energy to our customers. #Hurricaneseason #hurricaneprep'
b'Our senior meteorologist, Jeff Mock, shares what you can expect in the Mid-Atlantic region this hurricane season. #hurricaneprep #hurricaneseason'

b"It is a BIG day for the Coastal Virginia Offshore Wind project! The giant turbine components are being loaded up on the installation vessel today. We're getting closer to having the first operational #offshorewind turbines in Federal waters!"

b'We share the anger of our communities at the unjustified deaths of Breonna Taylor, Ahmaud Arbery and George Floyd.\nWe know we have work to do. And we are taking action, starting with a $5 million Dominion Energy Foundation grant. $4 million will be dedicated to organizations focused on social justice and equality, and an additional $1 million will support minority-owned, small businesses across communities we serve nationwide.\nLearn more by clicking the link in our bio.'
b'We are muted and listening. We are with you. :raised_fist_dark_skin_tone::raised_fist_medium-dark_skin_tone::raised_fist_medium_skin_tone::raised_fist_medium-light_skin_tone: #BlackoutTuesday'
b'40 years ago, the Dominion Energy headquarters in downtown #RVA went up, but today it came down as we transition to a new future, delivering sustainable energy. Check out the recap!'

b'Employees across our footprint continue to find ways to give back during this critical time. Take employee Rick Koher in Ohio for example. Koher volunteers regularly for Harvest of Hope by picking up food from local grocery stores for area food pantries, Salvation Army and senior centers to distribute to those in need.\n.\n\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m so thankful that my family doesn\xe2\x80\x99t have to worry about a roof over their head or having enough food to eat like many do," said Koher.  #employeespotlight #energizingourcommunities #givingback'

b'A graduation ceremony is something that most students undoubtedly look forward to. An end of an era; a time to celebrate all of the hard work while excitedly welcoming the next chapter in life. While the current "normal" makes a typical graduation unlikely, it\'s a time to get creative in making a lasting memory for these graduates.\n\nOur employee Sarah Peyton wanted to do just that. Arming herself with her camera (she\xe2\x80\x99s a photographer on the side), she volunteered to help Louisa High School in Virginia document a socially distant but memorable graduation for their students. #employeelove #empoweringourcommunities #giveback #actionsspeaklouder'

b"Today's the day! Watch the virtual @riverrockrva experience at 5 p.m. to see your favorite events come to life. 
Click the link in our bio to tune in.

#RiverrockRVA #RockTheOutdoors 
http://spr.ly/6014G6zPi"

b"We'll admit, our employees love a good challenge! With Virtual @riverrockrva right around the corner, our employees are taking it to the streets to clean up their local communities. While the current pandemic may have impacted our usual river clean-up employee volunteer project, there's still work to be done! Our employees are currently participating in the Trash Tag Challenge organized by our Workplace Sustainability Team, and you can too.\n\nIf you pick up trash in your neighborhood, share a selfie with #TrashTagChallenge. Don't forget your safety glasses, gloves, trash bag and to social distance from your neighbor. We can't wait to see your photos! #RockTheOutdoors #RiverRockRVA"

b':police_car_light: Big :dashing_away: is on its way! The components for both of these 6-megawatt Siemens Gamesa turbines were loaded up on a vessel in Denmark before a two-week journey to Nova Scotia, Canada. These massive turbines will wait there briefly before heading to Virginia\xe2\x80\x99s coast as part of the Coastal Virginia Offshore Wind project later this spring. Together, we are building a clean energy future :globe_showing_Americas:'

b"Your thermostat is an important tool to keep your bill manageable while you're at home. Keep it as close to 68 as you can on cool days, and close to 78 on warm days. Every degree counts toward your savings! More tips can be found by clicking the link in our bio."
b"It's been a great #EarthWeek2020! What have you been up to?"
b'Where does water come from? What happens when it goes down the drain? How is it cleaned? Try these experiments at home! Click link in bio. :backhand_index_pointing_up:'

b'Wind is power! Try to build your own wind-powered vehicle with this fun and easy experiment at home- click link in bio :backhand_index_pointing_up: . Share a pic and tag us to be included in our Earth Day highlights reel Friday!'

b"Unplugging at the end of the day isn't just important for you--the same is true for your electronic devices. Remember this tip to save energy while you're doing EVERYTHING from home. More tips can be found by clicking the link in our bio!"

b"It's Earth Day! Keep the celebrations going by harnessing the power of the sun to make a tasty snack! Click link in bio for instructions to make your very own solar s'mores oven and tag us in a post to participate in our highlights video!"

b"You never know what you'll find in the back of Mom or Dad's closet when you're looking for superhero costumes
.
.
We're grateful every day for our amazing employees working tirelessly to keep the gas flowing and the lights on, but today we want to also say THANKS to the families behind our team members. We provide an essential service, and that's something our employees and their families don't take lightly. We see you, we hear from many of you, and we are so grateful for the sacrifices you all are making during this very critical and difficult time. (Photo credit: Tiffany Hoylman)"

b"Earth Week celebrations continue! Reusing and re-purposing materials around the house is a great way to harness creative energy! Try a few of these eco-savvy Earth Day crafts and share your creations with us by clicking the link in bio.\nDon't forget to share photos of your family's creations and tag us to be a part of our highlights video later this week!"

b'Working from home? If you\xe2\x80\x99re tempted to use the oven to reheat last night\xe2\x80\x99s pizza for today\xe2\x80\x99s lunch, you\xe2\x80\x99re using more energy than needed. Try a frying pan or toaster oven instead. More tips to save time and energy by clicking link in bio!'
b"It's Earth Week! Celebrate the 50th anniversary of Earth Day with family-friendly activities. Click link in bio :backhand_index_pointing_up: for today's activity: a pollinator scavenger hunt!"
b"We #LightItBlue to thank those fighting on the front lines against the coronavirus. You've reminded us all about what it means to be a hero. Thank you! #HealthcareHeroes"

b"Now more than ever, we're thankful to the dedicated team of  professionals who work tirelessly, rain or shine, day and night to provide the energy to power our homes, businesses and our lives. Join us today as we #thankalineworker on Lineworker Appreciation Day today!"
b'As our world changes, one thing stays the same \xe2\x80\x94 our commitment to you.'

b"We know how difficult and stressful it is for our customers to be without power and appreciate their patience as we work to repair damage that impacted 265,000 customers across three states. We're continuing to work tirelessly until every customer is back on - most should be restored today by 11 p.m.\n\nIt is our top priority to deliver safe and reliable energy to our customers and the communities we serve."
b'Our crews are working diligently to safely restore power across our impacted service areas. Please be patient as they assess and repair storm damage. #StormRestoration #BeSafe'

b'Essential work takes on a whole new meaning when severe weather hits during a pandemic. Our crews are on their way to restore power across our service area. Please be patient as they assess and repair storm damage.'
b"We're listening and here to help. Matt Thurber from one of our Utah offices answers a customer FAQ. To see more, click link in bio."

b'You rely on us to meet critical needs, that\xe2\x80\x99s why our front line workers will still be responding 24/7.
.
We appreciate your gratitude to our crews, but please maintain a safe distance, at least 6 ft!
.
A friendly :waving_hand_medium-light_skin_tone: and :smiling_face_selector: are always welcome. #staysafe'

b'Art with an important message- love it! :blue_heart: Sawyer, son of North Carolina employee Gregg Whitmore, shares an important safety message. Make sure you call 811 before starting any spring projects requiring digging! Be safe and #stayhome.'
b"We're listening and here to help. Persida Montanez from one of our North Carolina offices answers a customer FAQ. Click Link in bio :backhand_index_pointing_up: to learn more."
b"We're listening and here to help. Peggy Fox from one of our Virginia offices answers a customer FAQ. Click link in bio for more info."
b"We're listening and here to help. \nPaul Fischer from one of our South Carolina offices answers a customer FAQ.  For more info, click Link in bio :backhand_index_pointing_up:"

b'Thank you to those on the frontline who keep the lights on and gas flowing to hospitals and homes in our communities. \nSafely serving our customers is what we do, every day. We\xe2\x80\x99re in this together.'
b"We're listening and here to help. \nSamantha Norris from one of our West Virginia offices answers a customer FAQ. For more info, click link in bio. :backhand_index_pointing_up:"
b"We're listening and here to help. Hedi Cho from one of our Virginia offices answers a customer FAQ. See link in bio :backhand_index_pointing_up:"
b'Kindness under stormy skies:smiling_face_selector: Who do you want to give thanks to?\n#chalkyourwalk #wereallinthistogether'

b"We're listening and here to help. Bonita Harris from one of our Virginia offices answers a customer FAQ about potential scams."

b'Who needs a pup pick-me-up? How about FOUR?! It\xe2\x80\x99s #NationalPuppyDay so we thought we\xe2\x80\x99d share some of our new WFH furry coworkers. We have to admit, some are more helpful than others...:smiling_face_with_3_hearts:'

b'The @americanredcross and other organizations leading COVID -19 relief efforts in the communities we serve will receive a $1 million donation from the Dominion Energy Charitable Foundation.\n\nClick the link in our bio to learn more.'

b'@limekilntheater in Lexington, Virginia is jump-starting its music outreach offerings, expanding programs for economically disadvantaged students.\n\nLime Kiln Arts is one of five Virginia organizations this year to receive a $10,000 grant through Dominion Energy ArtStars, click the link in our bio to learn more.'

b"Zero is our favorite number! We've ramped up the use of renewable energy and are investing in emerging tech and our employees to reduce our greenhouse gas emissions impact to net zero by 2050. \nLearn more: click link in bio :backhand_index_pointing_up:"

b'A few extra paws at this volunteer event did not make things more productive, but they did make things cuter!

Tag a friend who might want to adopt Felix, Jake, Sunny or Gallagher from @chesterfieldanimalservices!

Learn more about starting the adoption process by clicking the link in our bio.

PUPDATE: Sunny has been adopted!'

b'These pups from @ccpdanimalsvcs stopped by our volunteer event at Goyne Park Dog Park in @ChesterfieldVa \xe2\x80\x93 stay tuned for their video debut! Swipe :right_arrow_selector: :right_arrow_selector: to see all four \xe2\x80\x94 in order: Felix, Jake, Sunny and Gallagher.

b'The Arts Depot in Abingdon, Virginia is working to pass down the tradition of Appalachian quilting to younger generations.\n\n@theartsdepot is one of five Virginia organizations this year to receive a $10,000 grant through Dominion Energy ArtStars, click the link in our bio to learn more.'

b'The Alexandria Symphony Orchestra :violin: :musical_notes: offers free lessons to students through its Sympatico program in Alexandria City Public Schools. ASO Sympatico incorporates elements of social change with music education.\n\nThe Alexandria Symphony Orchestra is one of five Virginia organizations this year to receive a $10,000 grant through Dominion Energy ArtStars, click the link in our bio to learn more. #alexandriava #northernvirginia'

b"Trying to reduce your carbon footprint? :leaf_fluttering_in_wind: We've got your back! By 2050, the energy we produce will have a net zero emissions impact. It's one way we're doing our part to make our communities strong as we build a clean and sustainable energy future. :globe_showing_Asia-Australia: \nClick link in bio :backhand_index_pointing_up:"

b'Local artists :artist_palette: involved with @studiotwothree\xe2\x80\x99s Make Art Work program gain business and entrepreneurial skills that help keep our creative community in central Virginia vibrant and thriving. \nStudio Two Three is one of five Virginia organizations this year to receive a $10,000 grant through Dominion Energy ArtStars, click the link in our bio to learn more.'

b"#FunFactFriday: We're powering Virginia with so many solar panels that we could line them up end-to-end from here to Alaska! #LetTheSunShineIn #CleanEnergy #BrightFuture"
b'We\xe2\x80\x99re proud to help Arlington County in #VA and Amazon achieve their clean energy goals. Click the link in bio for more info. @amazon #solar #cleanenergy #renewableenergy'
b'Lineworkers can do it all. #DollyPartonChallenge'

b'Just five miles separate Bellwood Elementary School and our Chesterfield Power Station in Virginia. Our ongoing partnership with @cischesterfield at Bellwood is a part of our commitment to quality education for all students. Learn more about our community educational programs by clicking the link in our bio.'

b"We're helping schools go green! Eligible schools in Virginia are able to puchase a new electric bus for the same cost as a diesel model, thanks to a new electric bus program that will reduce emissions in our communities. Click link in bio to learn more :thumbs_up:"

b"Restoration is a huge part of what we do, especially after a storm wreaks havoc on our communities. We're proud to be recognized by the Edison Electric Institute (EEI) for our efforts following Hurricane Dorian this past fall. Hurricane Dorian caused more than 172,000 outages in our eastern Virginia and North Carolina service territory. Check out the link in our bio to learn more! #stormresponse #EEI #employeelove #hurricanedorian"

b'\xe2\x80\x9cBus, do your stuff!" This 2020 version of the magic school bus would definitely be electric. \nClick the link in our bio to learn more about our plan to bring electric school buses :oncoming_bus::battery: to school districts in Virginia.'
b'We are working with @siemensgamesa to help us build the largest offshore wind facility in the country! Clean energy jobs, clean air for our communities.'

b"Last, but certainly not least, here's your #6 photo. One of our team members hugs an Outer Banks, North Carolina resident after Hurricane Dorian. This family greeted our team members with homemade desserts and water as a thank you for the hard work and long hours our employees spent restoring power. \nAnd there you have it! Six of our personal favorites. Happy holidays, and we can't wait to share more visual moments with you in the new year."
